Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; frieze of lotus buds in added white outline with added red centres; below, white dot and billet band and band of alternate red and white tongues; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (rump, hind leg and dotted underbelly remaining) to left; below, part of billet pattern.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 298, no. 993)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1963) (phase 2)
